definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: I wasn’t satisfied with this routine.
sentences.chinese: 我不满意这一例行公事。

sentences.english: Zen monks create routines to allow themselves to work more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 禅僧建立例行公事使他们工作更有效率。

sentences.english: It's not only a daily routine.
sentences.chinese: 它可不只是每天的例行公事哦。

sentences.english: Access to space is neither easy, nor routine.
sentences.chinese: 太空旅行既不容易也非例行公事。

sentences.english: In the past, raising the debt ceiling was routine.
sentences.chinese: 过去提高国债上限是例行公事。

sentences.english: Prison life consists of routine and then mort routine.
sentences.chinese: 监狱生活充斥了一段又一段地例行公事。

sentences.english: We'll be looking at vocabulary and collocations related to office duties and daily routines.
sentences.chinese: 我们讲学习办公责任和例行公事的词汇及其搭配。

sentences.english: Astronomers routinely say that astrology has no scientific basis.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家例行公事地说占星术没有任何科学根据。

sentences.english: Life consists of routine, and then more routine.
sentences.chinese: 生活充满了一段又一段的例行公事。

sentences.english: This ritual between him and the hooker became a daily occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 这样的互动变成他和流莺之间每天会生的例行公事。

sentences.english: Prison life consists of routine, and then more routine.
sentences.chinese: 监狱生活布满了一段又一段的例行公事。
收集邮票是我的例行公事。

sentences.english: As was my routine, I glanced first toward the Cullens' table.
sentences.chinese: 如同例行公事一样，我第一眼便向卡伦家的桌子看去。

sentences.english: Prison life consists of routine- after which mort routine.
sentences.chinese: 监狱生活充足了一段又一段的例行公事。

sentences.english: Prison life consists of routine, and then mort routine。
sentences.chinese: 监狱生活充满了一段又一段的例行公事。

sentences.english: You can create routines that help you work more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以建立例行公事来让自己工作更有效率。

definition: to formalize/formalism in art (esp. as proscribed in USSR and PRC)
to exchange conventional greetings/to talk about the weather
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
to rush through the work/to get through a thing carelessly
to follow the prescribed order; to keep to the working routine (idiom)
not to affect sb/irrelevant/of no importance/insignificant
to elaborate (on a theme)/to expound (the classics)/perfunctory/to skimp/to botch/to do sth half-heartedly or just for show/barely enough to get by
